passage:
(1) Money is something that people use to buy things. It can be coins, paper notes, or even digital numbers in a bank account. Before money, people traded things directly. For example, a farmer might trade some corn for a new shirt. This was difficult because both people needed to want what the other person had.

(2) Money makes buying and selling easier. When everyone agrees that money has value, we can use it to get what we need. We work and earn money, then use that money to buy food, clothes, and other things. Money is accepted everywhere in a country because the government says it has value.

(3) There are different types of money around the world. Each country usually has its own money called a currency. For example, the United States uses dollars, while many European countries use euros. When people travel to other countries, they often need to exchange their money for the local currency.

(4) Today, many people use digital money. Instead of carrying cash, they pay with credit cards or through apps on their phones. The money still exists, but it's just numbers in a computer system. Whether it's coins in your pocket or numbers on a screen, money helps us get the things we need in our daily lives.

Based on the passage, money is useful because:

options.A: Everyone needs to have the same things
options.C: It helps people buy and sell things

questions.question: The word 'currency' in paragraph 3 most likely means:

options.A: Money used in a specific country

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what might someone need to do when traveling to another country?

options.A: Carry only digital money or credit cards
options.B: Exchange their money for local currency
options.C: Use euros everywhere in the world
options.D: Use only credit cards and cheques

questions.question: In paragraph 2, why does money have value?

options.A: Because it is made of valuable materials
options.B: Because everyone agrees it has value
options.C: Because it can be traded for corn

questions.question: What is an example of digital money mentioned in the passage?
The main purpose of this passage is to:

options.A: Explain what money is and how it works
options.C: Argue that digital money is better than cash

questions.question: According to the passage, what was difficult about trading before money existed?

options.A: People didn't know how to trade properly
options.B: Both sides needed to want what the other had
options.C: People had almost nothing to trade with
options.D: Trading was controlled by the government

questions.question: The passage suggests that money today can't exist in:
Which statement best summarizes the main idea of the passage?

options.A: Digital money is replacing physical money completely
options.B: Different countries have different types of money
options.C: Money is a tool that helps people buy and sell things
options.D: People should use credit cards instead of cash if possible
